Package handlers

Class ImageAsset

java.lang.Object
handlers.ImageAsset
public class ImageAsset
extends java.lang.Object
Represents an image asset for this Fish Simulator. Contains an image, whether or not it is immutable (way of representing background object), and whether or not it has already been draw. To be used in conjunction with an loader and handler
Author:
Sam Brenner
See Also:
ImageHolder, ImageLoader

    private boolean drawn

    private boolean immutable
    whether or not this image should be treated as a background image or not

  • Constructor Details

    • ImageAsset

      public ImageAsset​(java.awt.image.BufferedImage image, boolean immutable)
      Initializes this ImageAsset
      Parameters:
      image - BufferedImage to use as an asset to draw to a GameCanvas
      immutable - initial value for whether or not this image should be conisdered immutable or not

  • Method Details

    • getImage

      public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage()
      Accessor for the image asset
      Returns:
      BufferedImage that is the asset for this ImageAsset

    • isImmutable

      public boolean isImmutable()
      Accessor for the immutability of this asset
      Returns:
      true if this asset is immutable

    • drawn

      public boolean drawn()
      Returns whether or not the BufferedImage associated with this ImageAsset has already been drawn. Value of drawn set to true if this is an immutable asset
      Returns:
      true if this asset has been drawn to a Window
